GalaRP#

Ram pressure is a physical process that a galaxy experiences when it travels through a gaseous medium, such as the intergalactic medium or the intracluster medium. The gas is stripped from the galaxy, which can lead to the formation of a tail of gas and stars. This process is known as ram pressure stripping.

GalaRP leverages the Gala python ackage, combined with nonconservative orbit integration, to simulate the larger-scale effects of ram pressure absent hydrodynamical instabilities. Its primary purpose is to be an efficient tool for finding optimal setup conditions for hydrodynamical wind-tunnel simulations of ram pressure stripping.
